{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant document is 'Effects of epinephrine on distribution of blood flow in the pregnant ewe.' The study infused seven pregnant ewes with systemic doses of epinephrine and measured uterine arterial flow. It found a 38.5% decrease in total uterine arterial blood flow, with a greater reduction in endometrial blood flow (-58.7%). There was no mention of continuous intravenous infusion of low-concentration epinephrine, but the study did show that all tissues comprising the pregnant uterus are sensitive to the vasoconstrictive effects of epinephrine.", "answer_choice": B}
